item.title: MySQL master slave using docker
item.description: Docker makes it easy to run multiple independent mysql instances on the same machines for different projects. But some projects use a Master and slave setup of MySQL, where usually writes are directed to Master and the reads are directed to Slave. I based my approach on tegansnyder/docker-mysql-master-slave. But what I didn’t like about the existing setup is that it assumed mysql client setup on the host. I wanted to do it using the mysql docker images itself.
